page.title: 01 BATEMOOR
page.content: The area of Batemoor,on the southern edge of the city of Sheffild,comprises many types of council housing as its major landcover.They are all made from a mixture of brick,wood,tile and concrete but vary in construction from six storey high rise flats to two storey to town houses.There was only one small row of private terraced dwellings adjacent to the old A617 dual carriage way which runs through this area.There is one shopping centre with only twelve small shops,but also including a library,a health centre and a public house.Amid the council estate was one large old peoples home and two schools.On the edge of the housins area was an ambulance station and a pumping station.Over the border and into Derbyshire,the land was entirely under grass for dairyfarming.
